attributes.action: Petition to Subsidise Train Travel and Reduce Rail Fares Across the UK
attributes.additional_details:
Reducing rail fares encourages commuters to choose trains over cars, decreasing traffic congestion.

Affordable rail directly supports the UK's climate goals - reducing emissions and improving air quality.

Vienna’s €365 annual travel pass increased ridership by 135%, cutting congestion, pollution, and emissions. 
Lower fares boost sustainability, health, and economic growth, with additional revenue directly funding expanded infrastructure to meet rising demand—benefiting society and government.
attributes.background: Research shows maximum success from rail subsidies occurs when governments offer sustained low fares, unified ticketing, expanded high-quality services, dedicated funding, and complementary car-discouraging policies, as proven in Vienna (2012), Germany (2022), and London (2000–2014).
